triplets: Marine mammal belonging to the pinniped group
Not applicable; seals are wild animals, but they contribute to marine ecosystems and are studied in wildlife research
Flippers, whiskers, streamlined body, thick blubber layer, eyes, nose, tail
Gray, brown, black, or spotted depending on species
Marine ecosystem, food chain, polar and coastal habitats
100–300 kg for most species; up to 3,200 kg for elephant seals
1.2–2 meters for most species; up to 6 meters for elephant seals
